properties.Name: LegalEntity
properties.Description:
A Legal Entity ("juristic person") is a non-human entity that the law treats for some purposes as if it were a person, such as an incorporated organization. 

The law allows them to act as persons for certain limited purposes-most commonly lawsuits, property ownership, and contracts.

A Legal Entity has a "legal personality" that refers to the ability of an organization to enter into legal transactions such as holding property or entering into debt.

Legal Entities may enter into legal transactions such as the holding property or entering into debt. 

Ex:

- Companies 
- Cooperatives  
- Corporations 
- Limited Liability Companies (LLC)
- Municipalities 
- Partnerships 
- Sovereigns
- States
- Trade Unions

Note:
Not all organizations have legal personhood. A board of directors of a corporation is not a legal entity or 'legal person' in that it has no ability to exercise legal rights independent of the corporation that they are part of.

Columns.Name: LegalEntityId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Legal Entity.

Columns.Name: LegalEntityName
Columns.Description: The business name of the Legal Entity.

Columns.Name: LegalEntityDateOfEstablishment
Columns.Description: The date that the Legal Entity was established.

Columns.Name: CountryOfLegalEntityEstablishment
Columns.Description: The country in which the Legal Entity was established.

Columns.Name: LegalEntityEndDate
Columns.Description: End date of legal entity - Custom

Columns.Name: Status
Columns.Description: Current status of legal entity - Custom
